identificationModule.briefTitle: The Next Generation Vaccine Card: Innovative Technology to Improve Vaccine Equity in Rural and Urban Settings in East Africa
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Next Generation Vaccine Card: Innovative Technology to Improve Vaccine Equity in Rural and Urban Settings in East Africa

collaborators.name: African Population and Health Research Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The research team of investigators from University of Michigan and the African Population and Health Research Center will implement and evaluate a newly-developed digital vaccine card and accompanying mobile application and electronic immunization registry. This will take place in rural Uganda and urban Kenya Health and Demographic Surveillance Systems (HDSS) and the study team will analyze its feasibility, impacts, cost through process, and economic evaluations. The study team will also assess the data quality and equity of the digital vaccine registry and card system.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study design has three parts or aims for this project, however, only the third aim is considered to be the trial portion and is included in this registration.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Villages will be randomized to receive the digital vaccine card access with short message service (SMS) reminders versus the group of children whose village did not receive digital vaccine card access with SMS reminders (treatment/control).

armGroups.label: Next Generation digital vaccine card with SMS reminders for upcoming vaccination(s)
interventionNames: Other: SMS reminders for upcoming vaccination(s)

armGroups.label: Pre-intervention cohort
armGroups.description: This group will be compared to the post-intervention group to assess the digital vaccine card.

interventions.name: SMS reminders for upcoming vaccination(s)
interventions.description: All parents/caregivers of children in participating villages will receive access to a digital vaccine card. This will be used for record-keeping application (digital vaccine registry). Parents/caregivers of children in selected villages will receive SMS messages and reminders related to vaccination.
armGroupLabels: Next Generation digital vaccine card with SMS reminders for upcoming vaccination(s)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Diphtheria, pertussis, and tetanus first dose (DPT1) coverage
primaryOutcomes.description: Percent (%) of all children born in the intervention period that received the first dose of DPT vaccine (Continuous measure, 0-100%).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Diphtheria, pertussis, and tetanus first dose (DPT3) coverage
primaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the first 15 months of the intervention period that received the third dose of DPT vaccine (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 15 months of the intervention period (last 15 months of the intervention period)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dropout rate from DPT1 to DPT3
primaryOutcomes.description: Difference in the proportion of children born in the first 15 months of the intervention period that received the first and third doses of the DPT vaccine (Continuous measure, 0-100%)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 15 months of the intervention period (last 15 months of the intervention period)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the intervention period that received the BCG vaccine (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 18 months of the intervention period (full intervention period)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the first 9 months of the intervention period that received the Measles vaccine (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 9 months of the intervention period (second half of the intervention)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the first 9 months of the intervention period that received all basic recommended immunizations (BCG, oral polio vaccine (OPV), DPT1, DPT2, DPT3, OPV1, OPV2, OPV3, Pneumococcal Conjugate (PCV)1, PCV2, PCV3, rotavirus (Rota)1, Rota2, Rota3, Measles)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 9 months of the intervention period (second half of the intervention)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dropout rate from DPT1 to Measles
secondaryOutcomes.description: Difference in the proportion of children born in first 9 months of the intervention period that received the first dose of the DPT vaccine and the Measles vaccine (Continuous measure, 0-100%)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 9 months of the intervention period (second half of the intervention)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the intervention period that received the BCG vaccine by 4 weeks (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 18 months of the intervention period (full intervention period)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the intervention period that received the first dose of DPT vaccine by 10 weeks (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 15 months of the intervention period (last 15 months of the intervention period)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the intervention period that received the third dose of DPT vaccine by 18 weeks (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 15 months of the intervention period (last 15 months of the intervention period)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of all children born in the intervention period that received the Measles vaccine by 10 months (Continuous measure, 0-100%).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 9 months of the intervention period (second half of the intervention)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 1 day to 24 months old

Exclusion Criteria:

* Sites not included in the study

overallOfficials.affiliation: African Population and Health Research Center
